template.template: Template IBM - BC_AMM - SNMP - Chassis Stats
template.name: Template IBM - BC_AMM - SNMP - Chassis Stats

item.name: chassis stats - main status
item.description:
In the MIB, I was able to found that the following oid where the status:
For RSA: '1.3.6.1.4.1.2.3.51.1.2.7.1.0' For Blade Center: '1.3.6.1.4.1.2.3.51.2.2.7.1.0'
When you do an SNMP get on this, you'll have one of the following value:
0 for Critical 2 for Warning 4 for System Error 255 for Normal.
"Indicates status of system health for the system in which the MM resides. Value of 'critical' indicates a severe error has occurred and the system may not be functioning. A value of 'nonCritical' indicates that a error has occurred but the system is currently functioning properly. A value of 'systemLevel' indicates that a condition has occurred that may change the state of the system in the future but currently the system is working properly. A value of 'normal' indicates that the system is operating normally."
To have details about the cause of the status, you should look at the following SNMP table:
For RSA: 1.3.6.1.4.1.2.3.51.1.2.7.2.1.3 For Blade Center: '1.3.6.1.4.1.2.3.51.2.2.7.2.1.3'
http://sysmgt.blogspot.cz/2009/03/ibm-remote-supervisor-adapter.html
https://github.com/sileht/check_mk/blob/master/checks/blade_health

item.name: Management module temp
item.description: Management module temperature in degrees centigrade(C)

item.name: Chassis eror led status
item.description:
"Indicates whether the front panel system error LED is on or off.
NOTE: This MIB object is for BladeCenter only."

item.name: Chassis temperature led status
item.description:
"Indicates whether the front panel temperature LED is on or off.
NOTE: This MIB object is for BladeCenter only."

discovery_rule.name: Blade LEDs
discovery_rule.description:
"Table of blade status information.
NOTE: Querying objects in this table may take significantly longer than normal, so it is recommended that the query timeout be set to a large value. On a fully populated chassis, the timeout should be set to 120 seconds or more."

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPBLNAME} health state led
item_prototype.description:
"The system health state for the blade.
Unknown: Blade is in an undefined state. Good: Blade is operating normally. Warning: One or more outstanding warnings exist for this blade. Critical: One or more outstanding critical events for this blade. Kernel Mode: Blade is in kernel mode. Discovering: The AMM is currently in the process of discovering this blade. Communications Error: The AMM failed to communicate with this blade. No Power: No power to the blade's domain. Flashing: Flashing in progress. Initialization Failure: Blade failed to initialized. Insufficient Power: Not enough power is left in the blade's domain to power the blade. Power Denied: Power was denied to the blade."

discovery_rule.name: power usage of modules on PD1

item_prototype.name: Current Power Usage of module: "{#SNMPVALUE}" on PD1

graph_prototype.name: Current Power Usage of module: "{#SNMPVALUE}" on PD1

discovery_rule.name: Health of power modules
discovery_rule.description: "Table of power module health information. Contains the power health information for each power module."

discovery_rule.name: System health summary
discovery_rule.description: "Table of System Health summary. Contains more detailed information about the reasons for the overall system health status. NOTE: This MIB object is for BladeCenter only."

trigger.name: Front panel temp is high on {HOST.NAME}
front panel temp is very high on {HOST.NAME}
Main chassis status is "System Error" on {HOST.NAME}
Management module temp is high on {HOST.NAME}
Management module temp is very high on {HOST.NAME}
Status of "Power Domain 1" is not "good" on {HOST.NAME}
Status of "Power Domain 2" is not "good" on {HOST.NAME}
